results.title: Projector test film
results.brief_description: THE PRINTS FOR THIS TITLE HAVE BEEN CHOSEN AS TEST PRINTS FOR THOSE CLIENTS (OR POTENTIAL CLIENTS) OF THE CINEMEDIA ACCESS COLLECTION WHO WISH TO TEST THEIR PROJECTOR. ADVISE CLIENT THAT THEY SHOULD NOT SCREEN ANY OTHER FILMS UNTIL THEY HAVE PLAYED THE PRINT THROUGH IN ITS ENTIRETY AND ARE CERTAIN THE PROJECTOR IS IN GOOD WORKING ORDER. FOR ANY FURTHER DETAIL PLEASE CONTACT EITHER DESPATCH STAFF OR THE MANAGER OF THE 16MM COLLECTION REVIEW PROJECT. AC 6/11/1997

results.title: Projections for the future: a behavior model
results.brief_description: Discusses the use and misuse of operant conditioning as a social organizer. Also depicts one social system that might result from the application of operant conditioning methods. Suitable for upper secondary and teacher/tertiary levels.

results.title: Projection Privee = Private Projection
results.brief_description:
Denis, a young director who is still traumatised by the violent death of his young lover, decides to make a film with about this tragic episode. One of the highlights of this film is the insight it gives into the actual mechanics of filmmaking.

Credits: Director, Francois Leterrier ; writer, Francois Leterrier, Madeleine Chapsal, Bernard Revon ; photography, Jean Badal ; music, Serge Gainsbourg, Jean-Claude Vannier.
Cast: Francoise Fabian, Jean-Luc Bideau, Jane Birkin, Bulle Ogier, Jacques Weber.

results.title: Projecting motion pictures
results.creator_credit: University of California. Dept. of Theatre Arts. Motion Picture Division and William Jordan
results.brief_description: The most important thing a projectionist does is present a film, not just run a projector. The film presumes the student projectionist has a knowledge of the equipment which they are to operate. Stress is on the relationship between the audience and the elements of projecting - seating, screen, loudspeaker, projector and the projection procedure - rather than on the purely mechanical aspects of projection.
results.creator_credit_for_label: University of California. Dept. of Theatre Arts. Motion Picture Division and William Jordan

results.title: Project: Public Service
results.creator_credit: Australian Commonwealth Film Unit and Shan Benson
results.brief_description: The Commonwealth Public Service as seen through the eyes of a school-boy preparing a project book on the work of the Service. The film also briefly outlines the functioning of the parliamentary system and role of the public servants.

results.title: Project Vlad
results.creator_credit: AFTRS, Luke Dunn Gielmuda and Aaron Rogers
results.brief_description: Vlad is a Russian chimpanzee sent up to space as a cosmonaut in the middle of the Cold War. With the end of the stand off between the Soviet Union and the West, Vlad is trapped forever in an endless orbit, a victim of humanity and their history. This deceptively simple animation achingly conveys the alienation, terror and ultimate loneliness of the poor animal doomed to wander the cold metallic surfaces of his space pod. Visually and emotionally powerful.

results.title: Project Tinkertoy
results.creator_credit: United States. Dept. of the Navy
results.brief_description: A report on a joint US Navy-National Bureau of Standards project to develop a new system of electronics design and manufacture. this uses the ‘building block’ principle by which resistors, capacitors, tube rockets and other parts of common design are assembled by machines into functional electronic parts.
results.description: A report on a joint US Navy-National Bureau of Standards project to develop a new system of electronics design and manufacture. this uses the ‘building block’ principle by which resistors, capacitors, tube rockets and other parts of common design are assembled by machines into functional electronic parts.

results.title: Project out of school: planning a quality service
results.creator_credit: Video Media Production, Maryla Juchnowski, Suzanne Cecil-Fizdale and Alex Jaye
results.brief_description: Provides the considerations for planning quality out of school programs both before and after school. Shows a number of active programs, emphasises the advantages of holding such programs, and illustrates ways of involving parents, children and staff. Appropriate for Professional Development and Personal Development (Home Economics) at VCE level
